attributes.action: Get Les Jones an honor award off the Queen
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Over the last 33 years Les has played a very pro-active role in the centre’s development both as table tennis coach in the Wirral for hundreds of local children and young people and as Chairman of the Centre’s Joint Management Committee for 18 years.
Les helps an area of multiple deprivation and lowest on some of the Indices of Deprivation who has guided some of the areas more ‘unsettled’ youngsters and kept them on the right path.
In 2004 the Gautby Road Play and Community Centre Nursery/Creche was officially opened by the Right Honourable MP Frank Field and named in honour of Les. The building, through Les’s hard work, benefited from the investment of £250,000. The funding came from the Wirral Waterfront Initiative and Sure Start Birkenhead North and Les was instrumental in securing it.     
Les’s contributions to the centre have been immense and its no surprise to discover why he has been nominated twice before in the queen’s honours lists.
